slides.title: Welcome to CIMA BA3
slides.content:
# BA3 - Fundamentals of Financial Accounting

BA3 covers **financial accounting** fundamentals.

## What You Will Learn

- **Double Entry** - Bookkeeping
- **Financial Statements** - Preparation
- **Adjustments** - Period end
- **Standards** - Framework

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Concepts | 15% |
| Recording | 35% |
| Preparation | 35% |
| Other | 15% |

slides.title: Accounting Equation
slides.content:
# Foundation of Accounting

## The Equation

```
Assets = Liabilities + Equity
```

## Expanded

```
Assets = Liabilities + Capital + Revenue - Expenses
```

## Elements

| Element | Definition |
|---------|------------|
| Asset | Future economic benefit |
| Liability | Present obligation |
| Equity | Residual interest |

slides.title: Double Entry System
slides.content:
# Recording Transactions

## Rules

| Account Type | Debit | Credit |
|--------------|-------|--------|
| Assets | Increase | Decrease |
| Liabilities | Decrease | Increase |
| Equity | Decrease | Increase |
| Income | Decrease | Increase |
| Expenses | Increase | Decrease |

## Journal Entry

```
Dr Account X
Cr Account Y

Debits = Credits
```

slides.title: Trial Balance
slides.content:
# Proving Accuracy

## Purpose

- Lists all account balances
- Debits should equal credits
- Identifies errors

## Format

```
Account | Debit | Credit
--------|-------|--------
Assets  | X     |
Liabs   |       | X
Income  |       | X
Expenses| X     |
--------|-------|--------
Total   | XX    | XX
```

## Errors Not Revealed

- Omission
- Commission
- Principle
- Original entry
- Compensating

slides.title: Statement of Profit or Loss
slides.content:
# Income Statement

## Format

```
Revenue
- Cost of Sales
= Gross Profit
- Expenses
= Operating Profit
+/- Other items
= Profit Before Tax
- Tax
= Profit for the Year
```

## Cost of Sales

```
Opening Inventory
+ Purchases
- Closing Inventory
= Cost of Sales
```

slides.title: Statement of Financial Position
slides.content:
# Balance Sheet

## Format

```
Non-Current Assets
+ Current Assets
= Total Assets

Equity
+ Non-Current Liabilities
+ Current Liabilities
= Total Equity & Liabilities
```

## Current vs Non-Current

| Current | Non-Current |
|---------|-------------|
| < 12 months | > 12 months |
| Operating cycle | Long-term |

slides.title: Accruals and Prepayments
slides.content:
# Period-End Adjustments

## Accruals

```
Expense incurred but not paid

Dr Expense
Cr Accruals (liability)
```

## Prepayments

```
Expense paid in advance

Dr Prepayments (asset)
Cr Expense
```

## Matching Principle

```
Match income with related expenses
in the same period
```

slides.title: Depreciation
slides.content:
# Asset Value Reduction

## Methods

| Method | Pattern |
|--------|--------|
| Straight-line | Even |
| Reducing balance | Declining |

## Straight-Line

```
Depreciation = (Cost - Residual) / Life
```

## Reducing Balance

```
Depreciation = NBV x Rate %
```

## Entry

```
Dr Depreciation Expense
Cr Accumulated Depreciation
```

slides.title: Inventory Valuation
slides.content:
# Stock Valuation

## Rule

```
Lower of Cost and NRV

NRV = Selling Price - Costs to Complete/Sell
```

## Cost Methods

| Method | Flow |
|--------|------|
| FIFO | First in first out |
| Weighted Average | Average cost |

## Impact

Closing inventory affects both P&L and Balance Sheet.

slides.title: Bad Debts and Allowances
slides.content:
# Receivables Adjustments

## Bad Debt Written Off

```
Dr Bad Debt Expense
Cr Receivables
```

## Allowance for Doubtful Debts

```
Create/Increase:
Dr Bad Debt Expense
Cr Allowance

Reduce:
Dr Allowance
Cr P&L
```

## Statement Impact

Receivables shown net of allowance.

slides.title: Bank Reconciliation
slides.content:
# Reconciling Cash

## Timing Differences

| Item | Adjust |
|------|--------|
| Unpresented cheques | Bank statement |
| Outstanding deposits | Bank statement |
| Bank charges | Cash book |
| Direct debits | Cash book |

## Format

```
Bank Statement Balance
+ Outstanding deposits
- Unpresented cheques
= Adjusted Balance

(Should equal Cash Book Balance)
```

slides.title: Conceptual Framework
slides.content:
# Accounting Framework

## Qualitative Characteristics

| Primary | Enhancing |
|---------|----------|
| Relevance | Comparability |
| Faithful representation | Verifiability |
| | Timeliness |
| | Understandability |

## Underlying Assumption

- Going concern

## Key Principles

- Accrual basis
- Materiality
- Substance over form
